Description of incident: Several ATMs inside or near grocery stores in the Chicago area were outfitted with skimming devices.  ALDI checked machines nationwide and removed a number of debit card terminals after discovering the problem.UPDATE (10/1/10): A notice on the ALDI Inc. website reveals that customers in Hartford, Atlanta, Chicago, Indianapolis, Maryland, New Jersey, New York state, North Carolina, Pennsylvania, Charlotte (South Carolina), and Washington D.C. were affected by the breach.  The terminals were in stores between June 1 and August 31 of 2010.UPDATE (12/2/10): Eight thousand Maryland residents and 17,000 New York residents were affected.
